name: yarn.app.mapreduce.client-am.ipc.max-retries
description:
The number of client retries to the AM - before reconnecting
    to the RM to fetch Application Status.
    In other words, it is the ipc.client.connect.max.retries to be used during
    reconnecting to the RM and fetching Application Status.

name: ha.failover-controller.graceful-fence.connection.retries
description: FC connection retries for graceful fencing

name: dfs.client.write.byte-array-manager.count-reset-time-period-ms
description:
The time period in milliseconds that the allocation count for each array length is
    reset to zero if there is no increment.

name: dfs.client.refresh.read-block-locations.threads
description:
Number of threads to use for refreshing LocatedBlocks of registered
      DFSInputStreams. If a DFSClient opens many DFSInputStreams, increasing
      this may help refresh them all in a timely manner.

name: mapreduce.shuffle.port
description:
Default port that the ShuffleHandler will run on. ShuffleHandler
   is a service run at the NodeManager to facilitate transfers of intermediate
   Map outputs to requesting Reducers.

name: dfs.namenode.blocks.per.postponedblocks.rescan
description:
Number of blocks to rescan for each iteration of
    postponedMisreplicatedBlocks.

name: dfs.heartbeat.interval
description:
Determines datanode heartbeat interval in seconds.
    Can use the following suffix (case insensitive):
    ms(millis), s(sec), m(min), h(hour), d(day)
    to specify the time (such as 2s, 2m, 1h, etc.).
    Or provide complete number in seconds (such as 30 for 30 seconds).
    If no time unit is specified then seconds is assumed.

name: dfs.client.short.circuit.replica.stale.threshold.ms
description:
The maximum amount of time that we will consider a short-circuit replica to
    be valid, if there is no communication from the DataNode.  After this time
    has elapsed, we will re-fetch the short-circuit replica even if it is in
    the cache.
